meanings.definition: To put back in a former place or position.
meanings.sent1: She is replacing the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: I am replacing the toy in its box.
meanings.sent3: The cat keeps replacing the mouse in the same spot.
meanings.sent4: The sun is replacing the moon in the sky.
meanings.sent5: He is replacing the puzzle piece in its correct spot.

meanings.sent1: The new model is replacing the old one.
meanings.sent2: Winter is replacing autumn as the season.
meanings.sent3: The robot is replacing the human worker in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The rising star is replacing the established actor in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete is replacing the retired champion in the game.

meanings.definition: To provide a substitute or equivalent for.
meanings.sent1: I am replacing sugar with honey in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: She is replacing her broken phone with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The clown is replacing the missing juggling ball with an orange.
meanings.sent4: Laughter is replacing sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The new technology is replacing the old methods in the industry.
